link.title: Freeport Area School District Athletics - News

form.name: aspnetForm

small.font: Per Governor Wolf's order, all schools in the Freeport Area School District are closed through the end of the 2019-2020 school year. No events or activities will take place during the school closure, including over the weekends. Remote instruction will continue in accordance with the District's Continuity of Education Plan. Please visit the Updates for FASD Families page for information about grab & go meal distribution and for all of the latest news and information from the District. Thank you for your patience during this time.

div.class: col-xs-12 col-sm-8 col-md-4 col-lg-6 backgroundcolor column-2

div.a: How to reach the school offices during closure

span.p: All school offices will be closed to visitors during the current closure. School office staff will be available by phone from 8 am to 11 am by dialing 724-295-5141 and the extensions listed below:

p.br:
Administration Office - extension 1220
Buffalo Elementary School - extension 4000
High School - extension 1249
Middle School - extension 2101
South Buffalo Elementary School - extension 3000

span.p: The PA Department of Education strongly encourages all schools to provide some type of continuity of education for all students in the most appropriate and accessible ways possible, while also honoring the Governor's guidance for aggressive social distancing of at least six feet between individuals.
For more information on the Freeport Area School District's Continuity of Education Plan, please click here.

div.a: Message from Freeport Area School District faculty
Updates for District families regarding the current school closure

span.p: Click here for the latest information update. Additional information will be posted as it becomes available.

span.p: The first day of school will be Thursday, August 27, 2020.

span.p: Please note that in order to attend Kindergarten in 2020-2021, your child must be at least five years old on September 1, 2020. Click below for more information.

a.title: Click to read more about: 2020-2021 Kindergarten registration open

div.a: Read More about 2020-2021 Kindergarten registration open
Statistics in Schools Program and the 2020 Census

span.p: Freeport Area School District students are getting an introduction to the 2020 Census through the Statistics in Schools Program, which offers free activities and resources to help prepare students for an increasingly data‑driven world.

Census data guides how more than $675 billion in federal funding is distributed to states and communities each year for schools, health care facilities, roads, transportation, recreation centers, social services, and more. By responding to the census you will help our community get its fair share of that funding.
